citeinfo.title: SCHOOL FACILITIES (PUBLIC AND PRIVATE) IN FLORIDA -2017

descript.abstract: This dataset contains 2017 Private and Public School Information for the State of Florida. It is a combination of schools and educational facility addresses from various sources, including the Florida Department of Education, the U.S. Department of Education National Center for Education Statistics, and other sources listed below. The data contains selected fields denoting the physical address, school number, district, and contact information for schools located in Florida. This data is meant to be used for planning purposes only and is not intended to represent a 100% inventory of schools. School locations that have been verified are marked with the letter V in the FLAG field. This dataset is an update to the GC_SCHOOLS_MAY12 layer. This layer corresponds to the schools boundary layer GC_SCHOOLSBND_SEP17 available through FGDL.
descript.purpose: The data was created to serve as base information for use in GIS systems for a variety of planning and analytical purposes.
descript.supplinf: Master School Identification File Background and Use The Master School Identification (MSID) file is maintained by the Department of Education (DOE) to ensure the Department provides accurate identification and directory information on each Florida public school in the state. This file contains information for all public PK-12 schools as well as for adult and vocational-technical schools operated by district school boards. Information from this file is used for direct communication to the schools as well as for reporting data for each school. The Master School Identification file is used to edit all records submitted to the Department's Student, Staff and Finance Automated Data Base Systems. The MSID provides the universe for accountability reporting, including annual school grades and adequate yearly progress calculations. It is the basis for reporting to the U.S. Department of Education (USDE) via the Common Core of Data and Education Data Exchange Network (EDEN) reporting systems. The federally-assigned identification numbers, which are required for certain grant applications and for assignment of E-rate funds, are provided to the Florida DOE the year following submission of new school information to the USDE. Accessing the File Appendix A provides a list of the elements contained in the Master School Identification file. MSID information for each Florida public school is available on the web at: http://doeweb-prd.doe.state.fl.us/EDS/MasterSchoolID. The data are presented in three sections: 1) addresses, 2) administration and 3) accountability. Three ways are provided for the user to look up a school: 1) by the school name, 2) by the district in which the school is located and 3) by the city/town in which the school is located. School Type School Type is an indication of the level of instruction offered at the school. The School Type is derived directly from the Grade Code reported for the school. Elementary Schools: Schools providing instruction at one or more grade levels from PK through grade 5. May include schools serving grade 6 if also serving one or more grades PK through 5 (e.g., a K-6 school). Middle/Junior High Schools: Schools providing instruction in middle school configurations (grades 6-8) and junior high school configurations (grades 7-9). Can also include schools serving a single grade in the 6-8 range (e.g., a 6th grade center). Senior High Schools: Schools providing instruction at one or more grade levels from 9 to 12. Includes regular high schools and 9th grade centers. Combination Elementary and Secondary Schools: Schools providing instruction in grade groupings that include more than one of the categories described above (e.g., PK-8, 6-12, K-12, etc.). Adult Schools: Schools providing adult education instruction. FDOE Public Schools are from the Master School ID file, Public schools are from the 2016-2017 school year. http://doeweb-prd.doe.state.fl.us/EDS/MasterSchoolID FDOE K-12 Private Schools are from the Florida Department of Education K-12 Private Schools Annual Survey, Private schools are from the 2014-2015 school year. http://www.floridaschoolchoice.org/information/PrivateSchoolDirectory/Default.aspx **************************************************** The Common Core of Data (CCD) is a program of the U.S. Department of Education's National Center for Education Statistics that annually collects fiscal and non-fiscal data about all public schools, public school districts and state education agencies in the United States. The data are supplied by state education agency officials and include information that describes schools and school districts, including name, address, and phone number; descriptive information about students and staff, including demographics; and fiscal data, including revenues and current expenditures. http://nces.ed.gov/ccd/address.asp NCES public school data is gathered by CCD (Common Core of Data), Public school data is from the 2014-2015 school year http://nces.ed.gov/ccd/ NCES private school data is gathered by PSS (Private School Universe Survey), Private school data is from the 2013-2014 school year. NCES college data is gathered by IPEDS, College data is from the 2015-2016 school year. ********************************************************

idinfo.useconst: The Florida Geographic Data Library is a collection of Geospatial Data compiled by the University of Florida GeoPlan Center with support from the Florida Department of Transportation. GIS data available in FGDL is collected from various state, federal, and other agencies (data sources) who are data stewards, producers, or publishers. The data available in FGDL may not be the most current version of the data offered by the data source. University of Florida GeoPlan Center makes no guarantees about the currentness of the data and suggests that data users check with the data source to see if more recent versions of the data exist. Furthermore, the GIS data available in the FGDL are provided 'as is'. The University of Florida GeoPlan Center makes no warranties, guaranties or representations as to the truth, accuracy or completeness of the data provided by the data sources. The University of Florida GeoPlan Center makes no representations or warranties about the quality or suitability of the materials, either expressly or implied, including but not limited to any implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, or non-infringement. The University of Florida GeoPlan Center shall not be liable for any damages suffered as a result of using, modifying, contributing or distributing the materials. A note about data scale: Scale is an important factor in data usage. Certain scale datasets are not suitable for some project, analysis, or modeling purposes. Please be sure you are using the best available data. 1:24000 scale datasets are recommended for projects that are at the county level. 1:24000 data should NOT be used for high accuracy base mapping such as property parcel boundaries. 1:100000 scale datasets are recommended for projects that are at the multi-county or regional level. 1:125000 scale datasets are recommended for projects that are at the regional or state level or larger. Vector datasets with no defined scale or accuracy should be considered suspect. Make sure you are familiar with your data before using it for projects or analysis. Every effort has been made to supply the user with data documentation. For additional information, see the References section and the Data Source Contact section of this documentation. For more information regarding scale and accuracy, see our webpage at: http://geoplan.ufl.edu/education.html

attracc.attraccr: GeoPlan relied on the integrity of the attribute information within the original data.

dataqual.logic: This data is provided 'as is'. GeoPlan relied on the integrity of the original data layer's topology
dataqual.complete: This data is provided 'as is' by GeoPlan and is complete to our knowledge.

horizpa.horizpar: This data is provided 'as is' and its horizontal positional accuracy has not been verified by GeoPlan

vertacc.vertaccr: This data is provided 'as is' and its vertical positional accuracy has not been verified by GeoPlan

procstep.procdesc: The GeoPlan Center performed the following steps in order to create the 2008 statewide schools data layer. 68 Different Sources Comprise the Schools Dataset. The following Sources were either reprojected to the FGDL Albers NAD83 HPGN map projection or if no spatial data existed they were geocoded to a statewide 2007 TeleAtlas Streets dataset. For downloaded county and district wide polygon layers the label points were created and then used for each facility. Once the point sources were created via geocoding or reprojected existing point data they were merged into one statewide layer. Record (facility) duplications were removed by manually viewing and editing the statewide layer's attribute table for each of the 67 counties. Where record duplication existed source information of previously corrected FDOT Districts and Regional Planning Council data took preference followed by, County data, and finally geocoded data. Finally the FDOE state identification number and the NCES federal identification numbers were added for each facility with such an id. Next a table join was performed for each table (FDOE and NCES) to the master statewide shapefile. Un-used or duplicate fields were deleted. Below are the data Sources as described in the Source field in the attribute table.

Next GeoPlan Center performed the following attribute table adjustments. -Upper cased all records. -Added DESCRIPT field based on NAME -Socio-Cultural Effect data fields and definitions were added. FLAG, UPDATE_DAY, AUTOID, NAME, ADDRESS, CITY, ZIPCODE, OPERATING, OP_CLASS, SERVICES, COMMON_USE USE, YR_BUILT, FGDLAQDATE.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The GeoPlan Center performed the following steps in 2011-2012. Downloaded data: June 1st, 2011 & May 14, 2012- MSID all public schools from FDOE http://doeweb-prd.doe.state.fl.us/EDS/MasterSchoolID/ May 14, 2012- FDOE Private schools http://www.floridaschoolchoice.org/information/privateschooldirectory/DownloadExcelFile.aspx (Downloaded and merged All Schools Part 1 & 2) NCES public schools: http://nces.ed.gov/ccd/schoolsearch/ (Search State: Florida, then download as an excel file) NCES private schools: http://nces.ed.gov/surveys/pss/privateschoolsearch/ (Search State: Florida, then download as excel file) Community colleges: http://data.fldoe.org/workforce/contacts/default.cfm?action=showList&ListID=11 Colleges: http://nces.ed.gov/collegenavigator/ Location of codebooks/glossaries for downloaded tables: MSID: http://www.fldoe.org/eias/dataweb/tech/msid.pdf NCES Public schools glossary: http://nces.ed.gov/ccd/commonfiles/glossary.asp NCES Private schools file layout: http://nces.ed.gov/surveys/pss/privateschoolsearch/aboutdata.asp Downloaded gc_schools_jul08.shp from FGDL. Total number of records 7781 ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Spatial updates: -Converted downloaded Excel tables to DBF table in spatial database -Compared/investigated records in this table that were not in gc_schools_jul08.shp. Populated a h_check field by marking them as: 0= add to gc_schools_may12 and 1= already reside in the gc_schools_jul08 dataset, 3= investigate further. -Flag field: -V = verified. Verified means that the point has been visually checked, point is over building, and that the record was also found in the MSID -NV = not verified. Not verified means that unable to verify the school and/or its location -Duplicates were marked as duplicate and were later deleted -If the point was new, the point was moved from the geocoded generated spot, the SCORE field was populated with '0', SIDE was populated with '*', and MATCH_ADRESS was populated as blank. -A duplicate point of all superintendent offices was created and the name was calculated as "**** COUNTY STUDENT SERVICES/ MIGRANT/VIRTUAL PROGRAM/ MCKAY SCHOLARSHIP/ HOMEBOUND PROGRAM" and its FEDERAL_ID was calculated as the migrant program ID when available. ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Attribute table updates: -Cleaned up city, county, and address fields in updated layer, ex. Ft. Myers became FORT MYERS. Replaced sch with school when found. -COMMENT field records that were previously populated were given parentheses to separate previous update from current update -PARCEL_ID was updated for points without an ID by identifying the parcel boundary that the point was within and copying LINK field from statewide_parcels10.shp to PARCEL_ID -LAT_DD, LONG_DD were updated by calculating geometry tool -USNG_FL_1K was updated through a spatial join -For added records, source updated to GEOPLAN -FGDLAQDATE and UPDATE_DAY were updated -For public schools (OP_CLASS = 'PUBLIC'): -Joined gc_schools_may12.shp and MSID_all_schools.dbf based on STATE_ID -Updated table through field calculator: PRINCIPAL **see below for description of field and calculation PHONE LOW_GRADE HIGH_GRADE PROGRAMS **see below for description of field and calculation MAGNETINFO **see below for description of field and calculation TYPE **see below for description of field and calculation -Joined gc_schools and NCES schools based on FEDERAL_ID -Updated: STTCH_RT (in NCES table: STUDENT_TE) TEACHER (in NCES table: TEACHERS_) ENROLLMENT (in NCES table: STUDENTS_) TITLE1SCHO (in NCES table: TITLE_1_SC) FREE_LUNCH REDUCED_LUNCH (in NCES table: REDUCED_LU) -If school did not have a STATE_ID, then HIGH_GRADE, LOW_GRADE, MAGNETINFO, PROGRAMS (charter school status) were obtained from NCES public schools records by joining on FEDERAL_ID -For records in gc_school_may12 that were not joined, COMMENT field includes note "NO NCES 09-10 UDPATE" -For private schools, (OP_CLASS = 'PRIVATE'): -For private schools, FEDERAL_ID has multiple records under one unique ID. To fix: Ran summary on private ID, sorted count field descending. Created a query for all private IDs in gc_schools layer that had more than one count. Cross checked records against NCES attribute table. Corrected private ID for the one to one match. For the duplicate private ID, either remove ID or found the correct ID. -Joined gc_schools and FDOE_private based on STATE_ID -Updated: PRINCIPAL (in NCES: DIRECTOR) PHONE GRADE (in NCES: GRAD_LEVE) -Joined gc_schools and NCES_private based on FEDERAL_ID -Updated: LOW_GRADE (in NCES: LOGRADE) **see below for description of field and calculation HIGH_GRADE (in NCES: HIGRADE) **see below for description of field and calculation PHONE (in NCES: PSS_PHONE) ENROLLMENT (in NCES: PSS_ENR_15) STTCH_RT (in NCES: PSS_STDTCH) TEACHER (in NCES: PSS_FTE_TE) -For records in gc_school_may12 that were not joined, COMMENT field includes note "NO NCES 09-10 UDPATE" -If school did not have a STATE_ID, then HIGH_GRADE and LOW_GRADE were obtained from NCES records -For colleges, (USE = 'COLLEGE/UNIVERSITY'), Updated: PHONE OP_CLASS (in FDOE College: TYPE indicated public or private) ENROLLMENT (in FDOE College: STUDENT_PO) -Fields that were derived from fields within the attribute table, GRADES: LOW_GRADE & "-" & HIGH_GRADE OPERATING: Selected OP_CLASS = 'PUBLIC', removed PROGRAMS= 'DEPARTMENT OF JUVENILE JUSTICE (DJJ)' from selection. Field calculated selection as: COUNTY & " " & "COUNTY SCHOOL DISTRICT" TYPE: If private, based on GRADES selection -After attribute table was updated, STTCH_RT and TEACHERS were rounded to a whole number -All fields were upcased.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- GeoPlan process steps of public and private schools in 2017: The following data sources were used to update the public and private schools data set: (1) FDOE Public Schools Source: Master School ID 2016-2017 http://doeweb-prd.doe.state.fl.us/EDS/MasterSchoolID Downloaded on 02/20/2017. (2) FDOE K-12 Private Schools Source: Florida Department of Education K-12 Private Schools Annual Survey 2014-2015 http://www.floridaschoolchoice.org/information/PrivateSchoolDirectory/Default.aspx Downloaded on 02/20/2017 (3) NCES Public Schools CCD Public school data 2014-2015, 2015-2016 school years http://nces.ed.gov/ccd/schoolsearch/ * The directory information on school name, address, and phone number are preliminary data from initial submissions of school level data for 2015-2016. ** Data provided on student membership and staffing are from the official school level data for 2014-2015. Downloaded on 02/20/2017 (4) NCES Private Schools Source: PSS Private School Universe Survey data for the 2013-2014 school year http://nces.ed.gov/ccd/schoolsearch/ Downloaded on 02/20/2017 (5) NCES Colleges Source: College Navigator consisting of 2015-2016 data from the Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System (IPEDS), the core postsecondary education data collection program for NCES. http://nces.ed.gov/collegenavigator/ Downloaded on 04/14/2017 (6) FDOE Florida Colleges Source: Florida Department of Education College System Campuses http://data.fldoe.org/workforce/contacts/default.cfm?action=showList&ListID=11 Accessed on 04/14/2017 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Using schools data sets downloaded from the websites listed above, records were reviewed and edited to apply any available spatial and attribute updates. In most cases, school locations were checked using imagery and Google Street View and either marked as Verified or Not Verified in the FLAG field, please see the FLAG field Attribute Definition for more information. During the Spatial and Tabular QAQC duplicates and non-qualified points were removed. The final Point layer was spatially joined to a 2015 statewide parcel layer, and the GCID field was populated with a crosswalk ID linking each point feature with it's corresponding polygon layer feature, GC_SCHOOLSBND_SEP17. The GCID field replaces the SCHOOL_ID field of the previous gc_schools layer as the unique crosswalk ID. Finally, the GeoPlan Center performed the following attribute table adjustments: Populated and cleaned all fields. Fields added include: -GCID: replaces SCHOOLID as unique ID field -FSOURCE -DATASOURCE: replaces SOURCE -MGRS: replaces USNG_FL_1K field Fields removed include: - COMMON_USE - USE - ACTIVITY School services/programs from new datasets above that were located at county school district offices (for example:county student services, migrant programs, virtual programs, Mckay scholarship programs, homebound programs, etc.) were not added in order to avoid duplicate points at county school district locations. Schools or programs located at detention centers were not added with this latest update. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Attribute table updates by data source: For public schools (OP_CLASS = PUBLIC): (1) Joined GC_SCHOOLS and MSID Schools based on STATE_ID PRINCIPAL **see below for description of field and calculation PHONE LOW_GRADE **see below for description of field and calculation HIGH_GRADE **see below for description of field and calculation PROGRAMS **see below for description of field and calculation OP_CLASS (For charter schools) **see below for description of field and calculation MAGNETINFO **see below for description of field and calculation TYPE **see below for description of field and calculation (2) Joined GC_SCHOOLS and NCES Public Schools based on FEDERAL_ID STTCH_RT (NCES: STUDENT_TEACHER_RATIO) TEACHER (NCES: TEACHERS) ENROLLMENT (NCES: STUDENTS) TITLE1SCHO (NCES: TITLE_1_SCHOOL) FREE_LUNCH (NCES: FREE_LUNCH) REDUCED_LUNCH (NCES: REDUCED_LUNCH) For schools with no STATE_ID, HIGH_GRADE, LOW_GRADE, MAGNETINFO, were obtained from NCES Public Schools. For private schools (OP_CLASS = PRIVATE): (3) Joined GC_SCHOOLS and FDOE Private Schools based on STATE_ID PRINCIPAL (in NCES: DIRECTOR) PHONE GRADE (in NCES: GRAD_LEVEL) (4) Joined GC_SCHOOLS and NCES Private Schools based on FEDERAL_ID LOW_GRADE (in NCES: LOGRADE) **see below for description of field and calculation HIGH_GRADE (in NCES: HIGRADE) **see below for description of field and calculation PHONE (in NCES: PSS_PHONE) ENROLLMENT (in NCES: PSS_ENROLL_T) STTCH_RT (in NCES: PSS_STDTCH) TEACHER (in NCES: PSS_FTE_TEACH) If school did not have a STATE_ID, then HIGH_GRADE and LOW_GRADE were obtained from NCES records. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Attribute definitions from codebooks: PRINCIPAL_TITLE from MSID Codebook Attribute Definition 1 Mr. 2 Ms. 3 Mrs. 4 Miss 5 Dr. 6 Other/Unknown -Selected all 1's and field calculation as: "PRINCIPAL_TITLE" & "PRINCIPAL_LAST". Repeated process for all attributes, except did not use the PRINCIPAL_TITLE= other/unknown CHARTER_SCHL_STAT from MSID Codebook Attribute Definition R Regular charter school C Conversion charter school T Charter technical career center B Conversion charter school/charter technical career center Z Not a charter school -Selected all attributes equal to R,C,T, and B. Field calculated OP_CLASS= "CHARTER" TYPE from MSID Codebook Attribute Definition 01 Elementary 02 Middle/Jr. High 03 Senior High 04 Combination Elementary and Secondary 05 Adult 07 Other -Selected all 01's and field calculation as "ELEMENTARY". Repeated the process for 02, 03, 04, and 05. PRIMARY SERVICE TYPE from MSID Codebook R K-12 General Education S Special Education B Alternative Education V Career and Technical Education A Adult General Education O Other -Selected all A's and calculated field as PROGRAMS= "ADULT GENERAL EDUCATION". Repeated the same process for all other primary service type codes. *This field was updated according to the above categories only for those records with a State ID that could be joined to the Master School ID 2016-2017. MAGNET_STATUS from MSID Codebook Attribute Definition S Magnet School P Magnet Program Z Not Applicable -Selected all S's and field calculation as "MAGNET SCHOOL". -Selected all P's and field calculation as "MAGENT PROGRAM". -Selected all Z's and field calculation as "NOT A MAGNET SCHOOL/PROGRAM". -If field still blank after, field calculated as "NO INFORMATION AVAILABLE". LOGRADE from NCES Private Schools database Codebook Attribute Definition 2 Lowest grade in school is PK 3 Lowest grade in school is KG 4 Lowest grade in school is transitional KG 5 Lowest grade in school is transitional 1st grade 6 Lowest grade in school is 1st grade 7 Lowest grade in school is 2nd grade 8 Lowest grade in school is 3rd grade 9 Lowest grade in school is 4th grade 10 Lowest grade in school is 5th grade 11 Lowest grade in school is 6th grade 12 Lowest grade in school is 7th grade 13 Lowest grade in school is 8th grade 14 Lowest grade in school is 9th grade 15 Lowest grade in school is 10th grade 16 Lowest grade in school is 11th grade 17 Lowest grade in school is 12th grade -Selected all 2's and field calculated as "PK". Repeated the process for all attributes. HIGRADE from NCES Private Schools database Codebook Attribute Definition 2 Highest grade in school is PK 3 Highest grade in school is KG 4 Highest grade in school is transitional KG 5 Highest grade in school is transitional 1st grade 6 Highest grade in school is 1st grade 7 Highest grade in school is 2nd grade 8 Highest grade in school is 3rd grade 9 Highest grade in school is 4th grade 10 Highest grade in school is 5th grade 11 Highest grade in school is 6th grade 12 Highest grade in school is 7th grade 13 Highest grade in school is 8th grade 14 Highest grade in school is 9th grade 15 Highest grade in school is 10th grade 16 Highest grade in school is 11th grade 17 Highest grade in school is 12th grade -Selected all 2's and field calculated as "PK". Repeated the process for all attributes.
New and future schools added (20 total) from various sources including Google, county school districts, and the Bureau of Indian Education in Florida.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
Parcel Identification Number, derived from the 2015 statewide parcel layer.
The Federal (NCES) public and private school identification number.
The FDOE public school ID number.
Facility designation, facility name.
A description of a facility's physical location providing direction for delivery and provision of emergency services.
City of facility's physical location.
US postal delivery designation of facility's physical location.
County of facility's physical location.
The phone number of the school facility.
Educational grade ranges by category. The School Type is derived directly from the Grade Code reported for the school.

edom.edomvd: Schools providing adult education instruction.
College or University.
Schools providing instruction at grade levels from elementary to middle/junior high.
Schools providing instruction in grade groupings that include more than one of the elementary, middle/junior high, and senior high grade categories.
Schools providing instruction at grade levels from middle/junior high to senior high.
County school district office or school board.
Schools providing instruction at one or more grade levels from PK through grade 5. May include schools serving grade 6 if also serving one or more grades PK through 5 (e.g., a K-6 school).
Head start.
Kindergarten.
Combination of daycare/pre-kindergarten.

Schools providing instruction in middle school configurations (grades 6-8) and junior high school configurations (grades 7-9). This school type can also include schools serving a single grade in the 6-8 range (e.g., a 6th grade center).
Pre-Kindergarten
Combination of pre-kindergarten and kindergarten.
Schools providing instruction at one or more grade levels from 9 to 12; includes regular high schools and 9th grade centers.
County school district facilities including custodial, maintenance, transportation, and other services that support school operations.
Grade level not yet assigned.
Grade level unknown.

attr.attrdef: Entity owner of the facility.
The responsible organization for management and operation of a facility (e.g., FEDERAL, STATE, COUNTY, MUNICIPAL, PRIVATE, WMD, etc.).
Classification of the operating entity. (e.g., public, private, quasi-public).
The year a structure was built for determining possible historical significance.
Feature Spatial Source.
Feature Data/Tabular Source.
The main educational program offered at the school.
The grade level range available at the school.
The lowest grade level at the school.
The highest grade level at the school.
The school principal's name.
Total number of students attending the school.
Number of teachers. Teachers for this are full time teachers only.
Student teacher ratio.
Number of migrant students. Migrant has not been updated since 2008.

Designation of the school as a Title I school. Title I Status is designated by the school district based upon criteria in the No Child Left Behind legislation. A school's status is reported to the Department's Bureau of Student Assistance and is supplied to the MSID file by that office. Title I schools may operate school-wide programs or targeted assistance programs.

Type of magnet program(s) available at the school. Magnet schools and magnet programs offer a specialized curriculum to students outside the school's normal attendance boundaries attracting substantial numbers of students of different social, economic, ethnic, and racial backgrounds. These programs may include subjects like performing arts, technology, marine and environmental science, communications and international affairs and business. Program specialty areas include Academically Talented, Criminal Justice, Foreign Language, International Baccalaureate, Medical, Performing Arts, Science/Math, Technology and others.
Comments about school. Comments from previous versions of the layer are placed in parentheses.
Number of students receiving free lunch.
Number of students receiving reduced lunch.
First Florida Inventory of School Houses (FISH) Identification Number.
Second Florida Inventory of School Houses (FISH) Identification Number.
The presence of broadband service at facility.

edom.edomvd: Yes
Unknown

attr.attrdef: Provider of broadband service.
Broadband speed to and from facility.
Max download speed.

edom.edomvd: Less than or equal to 200 kbps
Greater than 200 kbps and less than 768 kbps
Greater than or equal 768 kbps and less than 1.5 mbps
Greater than or equal to 1.5 mbps and less than 3 mbps
Greater than or equal to 3 mbps and less than 6 mbps
Greater than or equal to 6 mbps and less than 10 mbps
Greater than or equal to 10 mbps and less than 25 mbps
Greater than or equal to 25 mbps and less than 50 mbps
Greater than or equal to 50 mbps and less than 100 mbps
Greater than or equal to 100 mbps and less than 1000 mbps (1Gbps)
Greater than 1000 mbps (1Gbps)

attr.attrdef: Date that attribute data was updated based on the FDOE Master School Identification File.
Date that attribute data was updated based on the NCES public schools dataset
Date that attribute data was updated based on the NCES private schools dataset
Date that attribute data was updated based on the FDOE private schools dataset
Latitude in Decimal Degrees.
Longitude in Decimal Degrees.

Military Grid Reference System (MGRS) Coordinate of the facility. The MGRS is the geocoordinate standard used by NATO militaries for locating points on the earth. The MGRS provides a means to represent any location on the surface of the Earth using an alphanumeric string. Hierarchical references are based on the Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) coordinate system. The MGRS is used for the entire earth. http://mgrs-data.org/
The GeoPlan Center identification number that links this point feature layer with its corresponding polygon feature layer.
Facility acreage.
FGDL added item based on NAME.
Type of update that occurred.

edom.edomvd: Verified, in most cases this verification was based on ESRI/Google Imagery, Google Street View, and Parcel Data. The exact facility boundaries are not verified and in many cases only based on parcel boundaries.
Not verified
Future school not verified
Closed school, verified

attr.attrdef: The date the data was last updated by the Source.
The date FGDL acquired the data from the source.
Unique ID added by GeoPlan

distinfo.distliab: The Florida Geographic Data Library is a collection of Geospatial Data compiled by the University of Florida GeoPlan Center with support from the Florida Department of Transportation. GIS data available in FGDL is collected from various state, federal, and other agencies (data sources) who are data stewards, producers, or publishers. The data available in FGDL may not be the most current version of the data offered by the data source. University of Florida GeoPlan Center makes no guarantees about the currentness of the data and suggests that data users check with the data source to see if more recent versions of the data exist. Furthermore, the GIS data available in the FGDL are provided 'as is'. The University of Florida GeoPlan Center makes no warranties, guaranties or representations as to the truth, accuracy or completeness of the data provided by the data sources. The University of Florida GeoPlan Center makes no representations or warranties about the quality or suitability of the materials, either expressly or implied, including but not limited to any implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, or non-infringement. The University of Florida GeoPlan Center shall not be liable for any damages suffered as a result of using, modifying, contributing or distributing the materials. A note about data scale: Scale is an important factor in data usage. Certain scale datasets are not suitable for some project, analysis, or modeling purposes. Please be sure you are using the best available data. 1:24000 scale datasets are recommended for projects that are at the county level. 1:24000 data should NOT be used for high accuracy base mapping such as property parcel boundaries. 1:100000 scale datasets are recommended for projects that are at the multi-county or regional level. 1:125000 scale datasets are recommended for projects that are at the regional or state level or larger. Vector datasets with no defined scale or accuracy should be considered suspect. Make sure you are familiar with your data before using it for projects or analysis. Every effort has been made to supply the user with data documentation. For additional information, see the References section and the Data Source Contact section of this documentation. For more information regarding scale and accuracy, see our webpage at: http://geoplan.ufl.edu/education.html

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
